title: How to Check for Head Lice at Home (Without Panic)
description: A practical, parent-friendly checklist for spotting lice and nits quickly and calmly.
body: Head lice are common and manageable. Start by using bright light and separating hair into sections.
Check behind the ears and at the nape of the neck first, where lice and nits are often found.
Nits are usually fixed to the hair shaft and do not flick away like dandruff.
If unsure, use an AI photo scan as a first pass and follow up with a professional check for confirmation.

title: Nits vs Dandruff: Key Differences Parents Miss
description: Learn the visual differences between fixed nits and loose scalp flakes.
body: Dandruff flakes are usually irregular and come away easily.
Nits are oval and attached to one side of the hair shaft.
If the image is blurry, results can be less reliable. Re-upload a sharper close-up.
When symptoms persist, speak with a GP or dermatologist for medical advice.

title: School Outbreak Response: A Practical 48-Hour Playbook
description: A communication and screening flow schools can use to reduce disruption and stigma.
body: Send a calm, factual parent notice with home-check guidance.
Encourage screening and same-week follow-up for affected families.
Avoid singling children out. Focus on routine checks and quick action.
Use professional clinics for rapid confirmation where needed.
